output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, you will be equipped with the fundamental knowledge and skills to provide initial assistance in various emergency situations, potentially saving lives and minimizing harm until professional medical help arrives.
output.courseTitle: First Aid & Emergency Care: A Beginner's Guide
output.introduction: Welcome to the First Aid & Emergency Care course! This course is designed for beginners with no prior medical experience. You will learn essential skills to respond effectively to common emergencies.

chapters.description: What is first aid? Importance of first aid. Legal and ethical considerations. Basic principles of first aid: Preserve Life, Prevent Deterioration, Promote Recovery.
Assessing the scene for safety. Identifying hazards. Determining the number of victims. Calling for help (Emergency Medical Services - EMS).
Understanding the importance of PPE. Types of PPE: gloves, masks, eye protection. Proper use and disposal of PPE.

modules.moduleTitle: Introduction to First Aid and Emergency Response

chapters.description: Introduction to CPR. Recognizing the signs of cardiac arrest. Chest compressions: hand placement, depth, and rate.
Giving rescue breaths. Using a barrier device (pocket mask). Combining chest compressions and rescue breaths.
Recognizing the signs of choking. Performing abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver) on adults and children. Back blows for infants.
Types of bleeding: arterial, venous, capillary. Applying direct pressure. Using a tourniquet (if necessary).
Cleaning and dressing minor cuts and scrapes. Preventing infection. Recognizing signs of infection.
Types of burns: first, second, and third degree. Cooling burns with water. Covering burns with a sterile dressing.
Recognizing the signs of an allergic reaction (anaphylaxis). Using an epinephrine auto-injector (EpiPen).
Recognizing the signs of a seizure. Protecting the person from injury during a seizure. What to do after a seizure.
Recognizing the signs of fainting. Helping someone who has fainted. Elevating the legs.
